title: Sheffield City Council: Staff hours for implementation of committee system

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
1) How many full-time or part-time staff did the council assign to work on the implementation of the committee system following the referendum in 2021? This could include staff for whom it is the entirety of their role as well as staff who are working on it alongside other duties though I would like to request that these two differentiated in the response if possible.
2) How many staff hours did the council assign to the implementation of the committee system? This could include staff for whom it is the entirety of their role as well as staff who are working on it alongside other duties though I would like to request that these two differentiated in the response if possible.
Yours faithfully,
Isaac Kneebone-Hopkins

Dear Isaac Kneebone-Hopkins,
Thank you for your request for information relating to committee system
which we received on 02/11/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. How many full-time or part-time staff did the council assign to work
on the implementation of the committee system following the referendum
in 2021? This could include staff for whom it is the entirety of their
role as well as staff who are working on it alongside other duties
though I would like to request that these two differentiated in the
response if possible.
Seven full time staff members were allocated to this work, for varying
lengths of time with 6 part time staff allocated to this work for varying
lengths of time. Please note that these 6 part time staff members include
2 full time staff members who split their time across other areas of work,
and we have therefore considered them part time for this work. In total,
we had a flexible programme team of 13 people throughout the delivery from
August 21 to July 22, with people phasing in/out depending on requirement.
2. How many staff hours did the council assign to the implementation of
the committee system? This could include staff for whom it is the
entirety of their role as well as staff who are working on it
alongside other duties though I would like to request that these two
differentiated in the response if possible.
This has been worked out by calculating the weeks between the individuals
start and end dates on this work and multiplying this by their individual
allocation figures. Please note, this does not account for days of annual
leave, sickness, the holiday break and also doesn’t factor in any further
nuance such as shorter or longer working days. As we have done this by
weeks allocated, this does broadly account for when the individuals phased
in/out of the work. These figures should only be considered a high-level
estimate.
